title: Reverse DNS Lookup
subtitle: Perform reverse DNS lookups (PTR records) to find hostnames associated with IP addresses. Automatically handles both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses with proper .in-addr.arpa and .ip6.arpa zone formatting.

googleDNS.tooltip: Perform reverse lookup for 8.8.8.8 (Google DNS server)

cloudflareDNS.tooltip: Perform reverse lookup for 1.1.1.1 (Cloudflare DNS server)

googleIPv6.tooltip: Perform reverse lookup for 2001:4860:4860::8888 (Google IPv6 DNS)

cloudflareIPv6.tooltip: Perform reverse lookup for 2606:4700:4700::1111 (Cloudflare IPv6 DNS)

form.title: Reverse Lookup Configuration
form.ipTooltip: Enter an IPv4 or IPv6 address to perform reverse lookup
form.dnsResolverTooltip: Choose a DNS resolver to use for the query

results.title: Reverse DNS Results
results.ipAddressTooltip: The IP address that was queried
results.reverseZoneTooltip: The reverse DNS zone that was queried (automatically generated)
results.ttlTooltip: Time To Live - how long this record can be cached

noRecords.title: No PTR records found for
noRecords.helpText: This IP address may not have a reverse DNS entry configured.

howItWorks.title: How it Works
howItWorks.description: Reverse DNS converts IP addresses to hostnames using PTR records. IPv4 addresses use .in-addr.arpa zones, while IPv6 addresses use .ip6.arpa zones with each nibble reversed.
